questions.question_text: What cloud service does Amazon S3 offer?

choices.A: Atomic updates across keys over the Internet

questions.answer_description:
Amazon S3 has a simple web services interface that you can use to store and retrieve any amount of data, at any time, from anywhere on the web.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/Introduction.html

Regarding Amazon EC2, when launching an instance, the user needs to select the region the in-stance would be launched from. While launching, the user needs to plan for the instance type and the OS of the instance.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ec2-launch-instance_linux.html
questions.question_text: A user is launching an instance with EC2. Which options below should the user consider before launching an instance?

choices.A: Select the region where the instance is being launched.
choices.D: Select the OS of the AMI.

comments.content: prior to launch the EC2, you also have to select the region as well.
The other answers are still specified BEFORE the instance is actually launched.

discussion.content:
Y can't A?
Question is before launching. Before launching we have to select the region. 
Answer it's mentioned while launching options, which is C & D.

questions.question_text: In regard to AWS CloudFormation, to pass values to your template at runtime you should use ____________.
questions.answer_description:
Optional parameters are listed in the Parameters section. Parameters enable you to pass values to your template at runtime, and can be dereferenced in the
Resources and Outputs sections of the template.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/concept-template.html

questions.question_text: What does Amazon S3 stand for?
questions.answer_description:
Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) is storage for the Internet. It provides a simple inter-face to manage scalable, reliable, and low latency data storage service over the Internet.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/gsg/GetStartedWithS3.html

Amazon WorkSpaces is a fully managed desktop computing service in the AWS cloud, allowing end-users to access the documents, applications, and resources they need with the device of their choice.
Amazon WorkSpaces offers a choice of service bundles. You can choose from Value, Standard, Performance, Power, or Graphics bundles that offer different
CPU, GPU, memory, and storage re-sources (SSD volumes).
Reference:
https://aws.amazon.com/workspaces/

choices.B: Amazon WorkSpaces is a flexible application management solution with automation tools that enable you to model and control your applications and their supporting infrastructure.
choices.D: Amazon WorkSpaces is a web service that enables businesses, researchers, data analysts, and de-velopers to easily and cost-effectively process vast amounts of data.
choices.C: Amazon WorkSpaces is a fully redundant data storage infrastructure for storing and retrieving any amount of data, at any time, from anywhere on the web.
choices.A: Amazon WorkSpaces is a fully managed desktop computing service in the cloud, allowing end-users to access the documents, applications, and resources they need with the device of their choice.

discussion.content: A. Amazon WorkSpaces is a fully managed desktop computing service in the cloud, allowing end-users to access the documents, applications, and resources they need with the device of their choice.
